intro: Acriopsis densiflora var. borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean denseflower acrid. It is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo, characterized by its dense inflorescences and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated margins and a velvety texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
